intro: Fumaria cava, commonly known as the common fumitory, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces slender, branched stems covered with fine hairs, and its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in dense spikes. Fumaria cava is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it has been used historically in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
